Meredith Grey wakes up on her couch and wraps a towel around herself. Meredith Grey starts picking up her clothes. Meredith Grey throws a cushion at a man, waking him up. Derek Shepherd sleepily hands Meredith Grey a bra. Meredith Grey feels embarrassed and tells Derek Shepherd to get dressed. They chat while Derek Shepherd dresses. Meredith Grey mentions she might be late for her first day at a new job. Derek Shepherd compliments the house, but Meredith Grey says it belonged to her mother and she is selling it. Derek Shepherd apologizes, thinking Meredith Grey's mother is dead, but Meredith Grey clarifies that her mother is alive. Meredith Grey adds that they don't need to pretend to care. As Meredith Grey sees Derek Shepherd off, she forgets his name. Derek Shepherd introduces himself as Derek Shepherd, and Meredith Grey introduces herself as Meredith Grey. Meredith Grey goes upstairs to shower.
Later, Meredith Grey leaves her car and joins the new interns at Seattle Grace Hospital. The Chief finishes the tour, saying the next seven years will be both the best and worst of their lives.

In the locker room, Meredith Grey connects with another intern, Cristina Yang. Meredith Grey and Cristina Yang find out they have the same resident, Miranda Bailey, also known as "The Nazi." Another intern, George O'Malley, overhears and introduces himself. George O'Malley nervously tells Meredith Grey they met last night and describes Meredith Grey's outfit but stops when Meredith Grey thinks George O'Malley is gay. The three interns, along with another intern, an ex-model named Isobel Stevens, are called to see Miranda Bailey. They approach Miranda Bailey and are surprised Miranda Bailey is a woman and not a Nazi. Isobel Stevens thinks the nickname might be due to professional jealousy. Cristina Yang dismisses this idea. Isobel Stevens introduces herself as Isobel Stevens, but says everyone calls her Isobel Stevens. Miranda Bailey ignores the introduction, shows the interns their equipment, gives a short tour, and explains Miranda Bailey's rules.

Miranda Bailey then gets a page, and Miranda Bailey and the interns rush to the roof. A helicopter lands with a patient, Katie Bryce, who is having seizures. In the hospital, the interns and nurses inject Katie Bryce, and Katie Bryce stops moving. Another doctor, Preston Burke, arrives and compares Katie Bryce to a wet fish on dry land. Preston Burke instructs them to perform basic tests. George O'Malley is assigned workups, Cristina Yang is to do labs, Meredith Grey is assigned to Katie Bryce and must get Katie Bryce a CT. Isobel Stevens is told to perform rectal exams by a smiling Miranda Bailey.

Isobel Stevens does the rectal exams. Cristina Yang gets the test results and hints to Miranda Bailey about wanting a surgery. George O'Malley tries a simple procedure on a patient. Preston Burke, annoyed, takes over and does it himself. George O'Malley jokes that Preston Burke probably made mistakes when Preston Burke started too. Preston Burke, smiling tightly, tells George O'Malley they will have fun together. George O'Malley feels nervous.

Meredith Grey is lost in the hospital with Katie Bryce, who talks about missing a beauty pageant. Katie Bryce mentions she was good except for falling during rhythmic gymnastics. Katie Bryce occasionally tells Meredith Grey they are lost.

A group of interns sits in the canteen after their first 7-hour shift. Isobel Stevens feels worried because a resident dislikes her. George O'Malley sympathizes, saying attendings dislike him too. Cristina Yang asks if anyone knew Meredith Grey's mother is Ellis Grey, a famous surgeon who won the Harper Avery Award twice. Meredith Grey quickly changes the subject, saying Katie Bryce is unbearable.

Preston Burke arrives and announces he will choose one intern for a surgery. Preston Burke picks George O'Malley for an appendectomy and leaves. Miranda Bailey tells Preston Burke she disagrees with his decision, mentioning that George O'Malley barely got into the program. Preston Burke argues that intimidating one will make the others comply, but Miranda Bailey keeps trying to change his mind.
Katie Bryce's parents visit her room. They check on Katie Bryce and then ask Meredith Grey if surgery is needed. Meredith Grey clarifies she isn't the doctor.

Meredith Grey approaches Miranda Bailey to find Preston Burke, but Preston Burke is no longer on the case. Miranda Bailey directs Meredith Grey to Derek Shepherd, the new attending. Meredith Grey notices Derek Shepherd, who is her one-night stand, Derek Shepherd, and quickly leaves. Derek Shepherd follows Meredith Grey, and they talk in a stairwell. Meredith Grey wants to forget the incident, but Derek Shepherd jokes that Meredith Grey took advantage of him. Derek Shepherd then asks if Meredith Grey wants to do it again the next Friday. Meredith Grey smiles, says it's inappropriate, and walks away.

George O'Malley is in the operating room. In the gallery, other interns bet against George O'Malley, but Meredith Grey defends him. George O'Malley starts the procedure well but accidentally pulls the purse strings too hard at the end, causing them to break. The patient starts bleeding, and George O'Malley is unsure what to do. Preston Burke steps in and finishes the procedure. The interns in the gallery nickname George O'Malley "007."

Afterward, George O'Malley worries about the nickname. Meredith Grey is paged for a 911 call about Katie Bryce and leaves. George O'Malley mentions he should have chosen geriatrics. Cristina Yang comments that geriatrics is for losers who never have sex and live with their mothers. George O'Malley quietly tells Isobel Stevens he needs to find a new place to live.
Meredith Grey rushes through the hospital to check on Katie Bryce, who faked a seizure and wants Meredith Grey to call someone. Annoyed, Meredith Grey leaves.

Nurse Tyler notices Isobel Stevens staring and asks what Isobel Stevens needs. Isobel Stevens explains that Mr. Jones has difficult veins and needs antibiotics. Isobel Stevens should start a central line but doesn't know how. Tyler smiles and tells Isobel Stevens to wake up Miranda Bailey, the on-call resident. Isobel Stevens timidly approaches Miranda Bailey. Miranda Bailey asks if the patient is dying. When Isobel Stevens says no, Miranda Bailey goes back to sleep. After a few seconds, Miranda Bailey gets up grumpily and starts the central line. Miranda Bailey warns Isobel Stevens that next time she is woken up, the patient should be near death.

Alex Karev looks at a patient's chart and tells the nurse they have pneumonia and to start antibiotics. The nurse asks if Alex Karev is sure, and Alex Karev sarcastically questions if the nurse went through four years of medical school. Alex Karev approaches Meredith Grey and mentions he has Jeremy as his resident. Meredith Grey responds that the patient might not have pneumonia but could be splinting. Alex Karev calls Meredith Grey a nurse, which insults her, but Meredith Grey has to answer a page from Katie Bryce. Alex Karev asks another intern if Meredith Grey is single, and George O'Malley says they are friends. Alex Karev tells George O'Malley to stop talking.

Meredith Grey rushes to Katie Bryce's room and is shocked to see Katie Bryce having severe seizures. The administered drugs don't work, so Meredith Grey instructs a nurse to page Miranda Bailey and Derek Shepherd. When the drugs still fail, Meredith Grey uses the paddles. On the fourth attempt, Katie Bryce's heartbeat and blood flow return to normal. Derek Shepherd arrives and tells Meredith Grey to leave. Miranda Bailey walks by and lectures Meredith Grey, but Meredith Grey ignores Miranda Bailey and quickly exits the hospital.
Cristina Yang is worried when she sees Meredith Grey vomit against a tree. Meredith Grey returns to the hospital and asks Cristina Yang to keep it a secret.

Inside the hospital, Derek Shepherd tells Katie Bryce's parents it might not be a seizure disorder. Katie Bryce's parents express their desire for another doctor, feeling Derek Shepherd isn't trying hard enough.

Elsewhere, Preston Burke explains a procedure to a patient. Preston Burke will use bypass to fix the heart. Gloria, the patient's wife, asks if she should worry. Preston Burke reassures Gloria of his skills but mentions surgery risks. Gloria remains concerned, so George O'Malley comforts Gloria, promising Tony Savitch will do well.

Cristina Yang, waiting for Derek Shepherd, sutures a banana. Cristina Yang calls George O'Malley George O'Malley when he laughs but quickly apologizes, saying she gets mean when tired. Derek Shepherd enters and says Katie Bryce is having seizures without a clear cause. Derek Shepherd mentions that the intern who discovers the cause can assist in the advanced surgery. All the interns take copies of Katie Bryce's chart.

Alex Karev approaches a nurse who confirms she paged Alex Karev. The nurse informs Alex Karev that the patient in 4B isn't responding to antibiotics, which should have worked. Alex Karev dismisses it, saying the patient is old, and asks not to be paged again.

Meredith Grey walks away, and Cristina Yang catches up to Meredith Grey. Cristina Yang suggests they work together for a better chance at the surgery. Meredith Grey agrees but says she doesn't want the surgery because she wants to avoid spending time with Derek Shepherd.

In the hospital library, Meredith Grey and Cristina Yang try to diagnose Katie Bryce's condition. Cristina Yang questions Meredith Grey about avoiding Derek Shepherd. Meredith Grey admits they had sex. They return to discussing Katie Bryce when Meredith Grey realizes something. Meredith Grey tells Cristina Yang to follow her to find Derek Shepherd. They tell Derek Shepherd they suspect Katie Bryce has an aneurysm, even without proof. Katie Bryce had a minor fall, but her doctor didn't mention it. Derek Shepherd investigates and finds out they were correct. Katie Bryce has a rare condition causing brain bleeding. Derek Shepherd notes she might have lived without issues and praises Meredith Grey and Cristina Yang. Derek Shepherd chooses Meredith Grey to assist him in the O.R. After Derek Shepherd leaves, Cristina Yang angrily looks at Meredith Grey and walks away.

Meanwhile, Preston Burke operates on Tony Savitch. Later, Preston Burke informs George O'Malley that the surgery was quick because Tony Savitch's heart was too damaged, and Tony Savitch died. George O'Malley is shocked and upset, reminding Preston Burke he had assured Gloria that Tony Savitch would be fine. Preston Burke is upset and says only God can keep such a promise. Preston Burke tells George O'Malley to inform Gloria.

Isobel Stevens and Cristina Yang are talking privately. Isobel Stevens suggests it might not be Meredith Grey's fault, but Cristina Yang disagrees. Meredith Grey arrives and tries to apologize. Cristina Yang tells Meredith Grey she can't seek forgiveness from her and mentions Meredith Grey's advantages. Meredith Grey leaves angrily.
George O'Malley is in the waiting area and tries to tell Gloria about Tony Savitch's death. George O'Malley apologizes, but Gloria asks him to leave and sits down in shock.

Derek Shepherd is shaving Katie Bryce's head. Meredith Grey says she doesn't want to assist, but Derek Shepherd insists. Derek Shepherd explains it's not because of their relationship but because Meredith Grey was Katie Bryce's doctor and helped save her on her first day.

Meredith Grey and George O'Malley sit outside, wishing they had chosen different careers. George O'Malley mentions his parents brag about him being a surgeon. Meredith Grey shares that Ellis Grey discouraged her from medical school, doubting Meredith Grey's abilities, so George O'Malley shouldn't feel too bad.

Richard asks Alex Karev some questions, but Alex Karev doesn't respond. Richard then asks the room if anyone knows the common causes of post-op fever. When no one answers, Meredith Grey responds. Richard asks Meredith Grey what she thinks is wrong with the patient. Meredith Grey correctly identifies patient 4B as a likely case of a pulmonary embolism. Richard asks Meredith Grey how she would diagnose it, and she answers correctly. Richard instructs Alex Karev to follow Meredith Grey's advice and removes Alex Karev from the case. As Richard walks away, he tells Meredith Grey he would recognize her anywhere because she looks just like Ellis Grey.

Meredith Grey goes to the O.R. where Katie Bryce is being prepared. Meredith Grey watches with admiration. Derek Shepherd invites Meredith Grey to take a closer look, and she does, feeling amazed. Meredith Grey realizes that it's more than just a game; they make it challenging on purpose because they have lives in their hands.

After the surgery, Cristina Yang praises Meredith Grey. Meredith Grey and Cristina Yang reconcile after a few minutes. Cristina Yang leaves, and Derek Shepherd arrives. Meredith Grey tells Derek Shepherd the surgery was incredible and exceeded her expectations. Derek Shepherd and Meredith Grey share a moment before Derek Shepherd departs, saying they will see each other around.
Meredith Grey later leaves the hospital with Cristina Yang, Isobel Stevens, and George O'Malley.

Later, Meredith Grey goes to a house in the rain. Meredith Grey informs Ellis Grey she won't sell the house, plans to get roommates, and mentions her fellow interns are great. Ellis Grey asks if Meredith Grey is her doctor. Meredith Grey says no but confirms she is a doctor. Ellis Grey asks Meredith Grey's name, and Meredith Grey reminds her. Ellis Grey thinks she used to be a doctor, and Meredith Grey confirms she was. Ellis Grey has Alzheimer's disease.
